snippet: The report for June was a sign that a manufacturing slowdown would stretch into the second half of the year. New jobless claims rose last week, but less than expected.
abstract: Commerce Department reports new orders for manufactured goods fell 0.5 percent in June, a sign that a manufacturing slowdown will continue into the second half of 2012; Labor Department reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits rose 8,000 in the previous week to a seasonally adjusted 365,000.
lead_paragraph: The report for June was a sign that a manufacturing slowdown would stretch into the second half of the year. New jobless claims rose last week, but less than expected.

headline.main: U.S. Manufacturing May Be Softening; Factory Orders Fell in June
headline.print_headline: U.S. Manufacturing May Be Softening; Factory Orders Fell in June
